intro: Lisaea strigosa, commonly known as the rough lisaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is native to regions in Europe and parts of Asia, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Lisaea strigosa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in woodland gardens.
